newsitem.title: FRANCE: Total says has no TOPNA offer.
newsitem.headline: Total says has no TOPNA offer.

text.p: French oil group Total SA said it had not received an offer for a merger or takeover of its TOPNA U.S. refinery and distribution business but was ready to consider such an offer.
"At this moment, Total has received no offer for a merger or acquisition concerning TOPNA." a company spokesman said.

He was reacting to an article in the Wall Street Journal that Ultramar Diamond Shamrock was in talks to buy Total Petroleum (North America) for $400 million plus the assumption of $430 million in debt.
"Everybody is talking to everybody in U.S. refining," the spokesman said.

"If there was an offer in which we would trade a majority stake in TOPNA for a minority stake in a larger entity, we would be willing to study such an offer," the spokesman said, adding Total had no intention to leave North America.
He decine to comment on the $830 million value mentioned in the report. "The value is a function of the market," he said.
